newsitem.title: UK: British Building chairman leaves company.
newsitem.headline: British Building chairman leaves company.

text.p: British Building and Engineering Appliances Plc said on Friday non-executive chairman Robert Paine has left the board of the company.
A spokeswoman told Reuters that Paine was requested to resign by the board "after due consideration of irreconcilable differences between Paine and the remainder of the directors."
The company said in a statement that RJB Jessop, a non-executive director, will take over the non-executive chairmanship until a permanent successor is appointed.
Jessop said, "Our disagreements with Dr Paine were of management style and chemistry rather than strategy."

He said the building and construction materials group would concentrate on achieving the company's stated objectives of enhancing the performance of the group and enlarging it through strategic merger or acquisition.
Paine told Reuters in a telephone interview, "I don't agree with what has gone on regarding the strategic development of the group."
